title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Functional Abdominal Bloating/Distension
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Functional Abdominal Bloating/Distension provides criteria for diagnosis of functional abdominal bloating or distension.

orgreference.text: Lacy BE, Mearin F, Chang L. et al. Bowel disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016;150:1393-1407.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for functional abdominal bloating/distension, patient must have the following (for 3 months prior with symptom onset ≥6 months ago):

  1. Recurrent bloating and/or distension occurring, on average, ≥1 day per week.

  2. Abdominal bloating and/or distension predominates over other symptoms (mild pain related to bloating may be present as well as minor bowel movement abnormalities).

  3. There are insufficient criteria for a diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome, functional constipation, functional diarrhea, or postprandial distress syndrome.
